result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Michael Suarez Jr.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:39 PM Defendant Juan Michael Suarez Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Juan Michael Suarez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued to allow additional time for attorney Hartz to speak with client.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Supervision  Report

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

04:05 PM Defendant Juan Michael Suarez Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Juan Michael Suarez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1150.00   with conditions, No contact directly or indirectly with victim R.P.P., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact directly or indirectly at 2455 North Street, Beloit with the exception of going to the residence with a Deputy/Officer one-time to retrieve personal belongings. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance  October 19, 2022 at 1 pm.
